intro: Cryptantha kinkiensis, commonly known as the Japanese cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It has slender stems and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
